result.translation: When the sun is wrapped up in darkness,
and when the stars fall down,
and when the mountains are set in motion,
and when pregnant camels[1] are left unattended,
result.footnotes: [1] Which are near delivery. It alludes to the distraction of people from their most valuable possessions, such as ten-month pregnant camels for nomadic Arabs.

result.translation: and when wild beasts are gathered,
and when the seas are set on fire,
and when the souls are sorted[2],
result.footnotes: [2] i.e., "joined" with their groups or sects, wicked with the wicked souls, righteous with the righteous.

result.translation: and when the baby girl buried alive[3] is asked,
result.footnotes: [3] As the pagan Arabs used to do for fear of shame or poverty. The Qur’an condemned this practice. See 16:58-59.

result.translation: for what crime she was killed,
and when records of deeds are spread open,
and when the sky is stripped away[4],
result.footnotes: [4] As the skin of sheep is stripped away.

result.translation: and when the Blazing Fire is flared up,
and when Paradise is brought near –
then every soul will know what it has brought about[5].
result.footnotes: [5] Of faith or disbelief, good or bad deeds for that Day.

result.translation: I swear by the receding stars,
that rise and hide[6],
result.footnotes: [6] This probably refers to black holes in the sky. "Kanasa" means sweeping or hiding.

result.translation: and by the night as it departs,
and by the day as it breaks –
Indeed, this [Qur’an] is a word conveyed by a noble angel-messenger.

result.arabic_text: ذِي قُوَّةٍ عِندَ ذِي ٱلۡعَرۡشِ مَكِينٖ
result.translation: extremely powerful, highly revered by the Lord of the Throne,
obeyed there [by other angels] and trustworthy.
Your fellow [i.e., the Prophet] is not a madman.
He indeed saw him [i.e., Gabriel] on the clear horizon[7].
result.footnotes: [7] i.e., the eastern horizon, where the sun rises. See footnote 53:6

result.translation: He does not withhold [knowledge of] the unseen[8].
result.footnotes: [8] He (ﷺ) did not withhold the unseen which Allah had revealed to him in the Qur’an.

result.translation: This [Qur’an] is not the word of an accursed devil.
So which way are you going[9]?
result.footnotes: [9] In your denial of the Qur’an for being the revelation from Allah.

result.translation: It is but a reminder to the worlds,
for those among you who wish to take the straight path.

result.arabic_text: وَمَا تَشَآءُونَ إِلَّآ أَن يَشَآءَ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّ ٱلۡعَٰلَمِينَ
result.translation: But you cannot wish except by the Will of Allah, the Lord of the worlds.
